body:
This is an offshoot of #4568. cc @jlowdermilk 

Here's a log from a single `kube-up` showing that it's getting it's context screwed over by the other clusters coming up at the same time, even those its local environment never changed:

```
current-context: "artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-2"
Running: /usr/local/google/home/zml/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl config use-context artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-5 --global
Wrote /usr/local/google/home/zml/.kube/artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-5/kubernetes_auth
Sanity checking cluster...
Attempt 1 to check Docker on node e2e-test-zml-5-minion-1fdv ... ESC[0;32m[working]ESC[0m
Attempt 1 to check Docker on node e2e-test-zml-5-minion-zz52 ... ESC[0;32m[working]ESC[0m

ESC[0;32mKubernetes cluster is running.  The master is running at:

ESC[0;33m  https://107.178.216.52

ESC[0;32mThe user name and password to use is located in /usr/local/google/home/zml/.kube/artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-5/kubernetes_auth.ESC[0m

... calling validate-cluster
current-context: "artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-5"
Running: /usr/local/google/home/zml/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl config view -o template --template={{$dot := .}}{{with $ctx := index $dot "current-context"}}{{$user := index $dot "contexts" $ctx "user"}}{{index $dot "users" $user "auth-path"}}{{end}}
Project: artful-fortress-786
Zone: us-central1-f
current-context: "artful-fortress-786_e2e-test-zml-1"
Running: /usr/local/google/home/zml/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl get minions -o template -t {{range.items}}{{.id}}
{{end}}
Found 2 nodes.
     1  e2e-test-zml-1-minion-3t2c.c.artful-fortress-786.internal
     2  e2e-test-zml-1-minion-j0kq.c.artful-fortress-786.internal
ESC[0;31mFailed to find e2e-test-zml-5-minion-1fdv, cluster is probably broken.ESC[0m
     1  e2e-test-zml-1-minion-3t2c.c.artful-fortress-786.internal
     2  e2e-test-zml-1-minion-j0kq.c.artful-fortress-786.internal
2015/02/19 07:37:59 Error running up: exit status 1
2015/02/19 07:37:59 Error starting e2e cluster. Aborting.
exit status 1
```

Here's the relevant part of the new script:

```
  for count in $(seq 1 ${clusters}); do
    export KUBE_GCE_INSTANCE_PREFIX=e2e-test-${USER}-${count}
    export KUBE_GCE_CLUSTER_CLASS_B="10.${count}"
    local e2e_report_dir=${KUBE_ROOT}/_output/e2e/${KUBE_GCE_INSTANCE_PREFIX}
    mkdir -p ${e2e_report_dir}
    go run hack/e2e.go -up -v |& tee ${e2e_report_dir}/up.log &
  done
```

(`KUBE_GCE_CLUSTER_CLASS_B` is in a separate commit and allows the override of `10.24{4,5}` on the GCE `config-{default,test}.sh` so that this script can work.)

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Parallel racing `kube-up` very confused, can't maintain context
